item.title: TonRunner
item.description:
TonRunner

I am fortunate enough to be the event director of Tonbridge parkrun so there will be plenty of posts from there.

item.title: The 25 Golden Rules of Running
item.description:
The 25 Golden Rules of Running

The most effective training mimics the event for which you're training. This is the cardinal rule of training for any activity. If you want to run a 10-K at seven-minute-per-mile pace, you need to do some running at that pace.

item.title: Race to the Stones - UK's #1 Ultra Marathon
item.description:
Race to the Stones - UK's #1 Ultra Marathon

The Dixons Carphone Race to the Stones is a fully supported 100km challenge along the iconic Ridgeway. Whether you run it or walk it, complete it in one go or stay overnight in our basecamp, the event is guaranteed to be the challenge of a lifetime.

item.title: 2016 Race Schedule
item.description:
2016 Race Schedule

I like competing, I never used to but I have found more and more that I do. It maybe that I have come to accept that I am not really competing against anyone else merely against myself; can I go further faster or higher than I have done before. I think it also comes with the realisation that there is always going to be somebody better than you.Â

item.title: Dame Kelly Holmes joins in Tonbridge Park Run
item.description:
Dame Kelly Holmes joins in Tonbridge Park Run

Partakers in this morning's Tonbridge Park run were put through their paces by double Olympic champion Kelly Holmes. The dame joined runners at the 5km weekly event, which starts at 9am every Saturday in Tonbridge Park. She tweeted afterwards that the biggest challenge was the bitingly cold temperatures.
